title: Find a derivative value from a Taylor polynomial

content.question: The third-degree Taylor polynomial for a function f about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGinaaaa@3BBC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>512</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>64</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@50F9@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>‴</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C85@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?
